Sent: Monday, July 28, 2003 1:27 PM
Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Pure-REST Wiki experiment


> Question for the group: Suppose that the wiki also rendered into ASCII.
Is
> there some convention for retrieving the source rather than the output
> beyond a slight hack involving coercing them to have different
> content-types?

Slightly different URI?  For instance, given a folder in my blog system, you
can return different formats as follows:

http://www.seairth.com/blog?rss=0.91
http://www.seairth.com/blog?rss=0.92
http://www.seairth.com/blog?rss=0.93
http://www.seairth.com/blog?rss=2.0

Using a content-type of "text/xml" would not be enough.  In the wiki, maybe
you could add a global "type" URL parameter so that you could do something
like:

http://example.com/wiki/HomePage?type=editable
